metadata.title: CVE-2013-2131 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description:
Format string vulnerability in the rrdtool module 1.4.7 for Python, as usedin Zenoss, allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service(crash) via format string specifiers to the rrdtool.graph function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2131` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

librrd8 - 1.7.2-3build1
librrdp-perl - 1.7.2-3build1
librrds-perl - 1.7.2-3build1
lua-rrd - 1.7.2-3build1
python3-rrdtool - 1.7.2-3build1
rrdcached - 1.7.2-3build1
rrdtool - 1.7.2-3build1
rrdtool-tcl - 1.7.2-3build1
ruby-rrd - 1.7.2-3build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rrdtool package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.7.2-3build1').
